intro: Cordylanthus frutescens, commonly known as the stickyleaf flax, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its small, white or pale pink flowers bloom in late spring, and it produces hairy, segmented pods that contain several seeds. Cordylanthus frutescens is often found in disturbed soils and is considered a pioneer species in certain ecosystems.
